<start_of_turn>user

<start_of_turn>model
A pin is a piece cannot move because it would expose a more valuable piece. For example, a bishop on g2 pinning a knight on f3 to the king on g1. The knight cannot move because it would expose the king to check.<end_of_turn>

What is a fork in chess?<end_of_turn>
<start_of_turn>model
A fork is a piece attacks two enemy pieces simultaneously. For example, a knight on e5 attacking both a rook on a1 and a queen on h8 creates a fork. Knights are particularly good at forking due to their unique L-shaped movement.<end_of_turn>
